result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmy R Medina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid within 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmy R Medina

records.addlTxt:
03:30 PM Defendant Jimmy R Medina in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for sentencing after plea hearing held 5/18/22.
State has complied with victim's rights. 
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Court orders the following:	
Restitution: $0
Fine:  $757
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Surcharges:  To be paid in 90 days.  Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.
Sentencing hearing on June 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
to Seal Victim Impact Statement(s) signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow 05/24/2022.
to Seal Victim Impact Statement(s)

to the Court filed by State requesting adjournment of 5/25 Sentencing hearing.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 05/20/22--Approved.**
Sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

08:46 AM Defendant Jimmy R Medina in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea hearing.
State requests a separate sentencing hearing so victim may request restitution and/or appear.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered - Jury Instructions.
Hearing on May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A (including Victim A's wife)/Backstreet Pub listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:00 AM Defendant Jimmy R Medina in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
